intro: Baeckea dimorphandra, commonly known as the variable baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight reddish or purple hue on the underside. Baeckea dimorphandra is generally found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal or dry environments.
